result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prosecuting attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter John Vaughn in court, previously sworn. Counsel advises is not challenging report. records.addlTxt: Clerk confirmed Dr. Westendorf will perform NGI examination for defendant. Proposed Order forwarded to B1 Jdash for signature and to be emailed to Dr. Westendorf.

Cases 22CF131/22TR895/22CT160 - Spanish Interpreter John Vaughn - 9:14 AM Defendant Cristopher Cruz Gonzalez in court.  Attorney Julius Andriusis in court for Cristopher Cruz Gonzalez. Atty. Benjamin Lindsay appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has a pending Waukesha case, asked for competency evaluation. Atty. Andriusis requests competency report be done on this case. Clerk will contact WI Forensic Unit regarding evaluation being completed at same time as Waukesha case. Case to be scheduled in B2 for interpreter court. Court enters not guilty plea on the citations on file. Atty Andriusis requests removal of scram bracelet, cannot afford it. State opposes. Court will not order removal of scram bracelet. Case recalled at 9:20 am with same appearances. Counsel clarified he is entering a NGI plea, requesting examination. Court so orders.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Further proceedings on October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Court orders scram be installed on the close of business of the date he is released from custody, if he cannot get it on that date, he must be held until he can have scram installed.

B1 hearing for B3 - Spanish Interpreter 247771 - 1:34 PM Defendant Cristopher Cruz Gonzalez in court.  Attorney Antonella Aleman Zientak in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof.  Defendant needs a spanish interpreter on all future court dates. Defendant will contact the Public Defender's office.  Plea of not guilty entered. Court is informed there is a pending OWI first in Ozaukee County and OWI in Waukesha County. State recommends bail of $10,000 cash w/conditions. Court orders $7500 cash bail w/conditions. Court finds good cause for extending time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
